description: The usefulness of cesium chloride (CsCl) step gradients and continuous gradients for the separation of viruses is based on the differing buoyant densities of viruses, bacteria, and extracellular debris. This protocol provides a method for Cesium Chloride and DNA Extraction for Viruses (See guidelines for DNA Extraction).
guidelines:
This protocol is part of a larger collection of Cesium-Chloride related protocols. This is number (1) of (4):
1. Cesium Chloride Gradients
2. CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
3. Cesium Chloride and DNA Extraction of Viruses using Wizard Prep Columns
4. Cesium Chloride Dialysis for Viruses

Needed:
  • Cesium chloride
  • Seawater that has been 0.02µm or 0.2µm filtered and autoclaved
  • Balance
  • Sterile pipet tip
  • Gradient fractionator
  • Centrifuge (SW40 or SW28 Beckman) @ 24,000rpm
  • Sterile 0.5ml tubes
  • Sterile 1.5ml tubes
  • Rack
  • Ring stand
  • Sterile 20 guage needle
  • 4-place balance
  • SYBR Gold Nucleic Acid Gel Stain
  • Fluorescent Scope
  • Wizard DNA Purification Resin
  • Wizard Minicolumn
  • Syringe
  • Plunger
  • 1.5ml centrifuge tube
  • 80% isopropanol
  • TE buffer

DNA extraction
Wizard DNA Purification Resin (Promega #A7181)
Wizard Mini Columns (Promega #A7211)
Phage Buffer to dilute if necessary (150mM NaCl, 40mM Tris-Cl, pH7.4, 10mM MgSO4 in nuclease-free water; fliter sterilized)

Mix 1ml DNA Purification Resin with 0.5 ml CsCl sample (can use up to 1ml sample but more than that will significantly decrease yield of DNA).  Attach minicolumn to bottom of 3ml or 5ml sterile syringe that has had plunger removed.  Add resin with sample to the syringe and push through the solution (can save flow-thru just in case you think you overloaded the resin).  Remove minicolumn from the syringe and pull out plunger.  Reattach minicolumn to the syringe and 2ml of 80% isopropanol to the syringe.  Using the plunger push through the isopropanol to wash the resin.  Remove minicolumn from syringe and place in a sterile 1.5ml centrifuge tube.  Centrifuge 10,000 g for 2min to remove any residual liquid.  Place minicolumn in new sterile 1.5mil centrifuge tube.  Add 100μl 80oC TE buffer to top of minicolumn.  Place tube lid over top of column and vortex for 10 seconds.  Wait another 30 seconds and then immediately centrifuge at 10,000 g for 30 sec to elute DNA.  Can repeat this a second time using 50μl warm TE (do not pool the 2 elutions until you quantify so as not to dilute the sample).  Usually can recover an addition 10-20% of DNA with the second elution.



Note: if you have more than 1ml of CsCl sample, you can use more Wizard columns, or you can concentrate prior to DNA extraction using Amicon Ultra Concentrators (100kDa MWCO). Try to use the size that fits most of your sample in one or two spins; spin at 1000g for 5 min at 10°C and check volume. If you need to add more volume to the retenate, use the flow through to do this.

components.data: Prepare cesium chloride densities of p1.2, p1.4, p1.5 and p1.65 in seawater (sw) that has been 0.02μm (or 0.2μm) filtered and autoclaved.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare cesium chloride densities of p1.2, p1.4, p1.5 and p1.65 in seawater (sw) that has been 0.02μm (or 0.2μm) filtered and autoclaved.

components.data: Place tube of prepared cesium on balance
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place tube of prepared cesium on balance
Tare balance to 0

components.data:
Remove 1ml with sterile pipet tip.

p1.2 11.19g per 50ml seawater
p1.4 26.94g per 50ml seawater
p1.5 33.74g per 50ml seawater
p1.65 43.78g per 50ml seawater

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 4 of Cesium Chloride Gradients
source_data.annotation: Difference in weight should be equal to the density of the solution (eg, 1ml of p1.2 should weigh 1.2ml). Adjust as needed.
source_data.thread_text: Difference in weight should be equal to the density of the solution (eg, 1ml of p1.2 should weigh 1.2ml). Adjust as needed.
source_data.body: Difference in weight should be equal to the density of the solution (eg, 1ml of p1.2 should weigh 1.2ml). Adjust as needed.

components.data:
Layer CsCl from the bottom using a gradient fractionator if you have one or by hand:

SW40 rotor: 2ml p1.65
  3ml p1.5
  3ml p1.4
  1ml p1.2
SW28 rotor: 5ml p1.65
  8ml p1.5
  9ml p1.4
  3ml p1.65
components.name: Description

Layer CsCl from the bottom using a gradient fractionator if you have one or by hand:

SW40 rotor: 2ml p1.65

  1ml p1.2
SW28 rotor: 5ml p1.65
  8ml p1.5
  9ml p1.4
  3ml p1.65

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 5 of Cesium Chloride Gradients
source_data.annotation: The p1.2 layer is to equilibrate sample before it hits the p1.4 cesium layer
source_data.thread_text: The p1.2 layer is to equilibrate sample before it hits the p1.4 cesium layer
source_data.body: The p1.2 layer is to equilibrate sample before it hits the p1.4 cesium layer

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 5 of Cesium Chloride Gradients
Annotation on step 5 of Cesium Chloride Gradients
source_data.annotation: This was done with a fraction collector (Labconco) but you can carefully layer these solutions with Pasteur pipets.
source_data.thread_text: This was done with a fraction collector (Labconco) but you can carefully layer these solutions with Pasteur pipets.

components.data: Carefully layer on sample (~5ml can be layered with SW40 ~15ml with SW28).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully layer on sample (~5ml can be layered with SW40 ~15ml with SW28).

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 6 of Cesium Chloride Gradients
source_data.annotation:
Use thin-walled SW40 or SW28 tubes!
~5ml can be layered with SW40, ~15ml with SW28)

source_data.description: Weigh and balance tubes.

components.data: Centrifuge using SW40 or SW28 Beckman rotor @ 24,000rpm for 4hr at 4°C
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge using SW40 or SW28 Beckman rotor @ 24,000rpm for 4hr at 4°C

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 8 of Cesium Chloride Gradients
source_data.annotation: With a SW-48 swinging-bucket rotor (Beckman), setting 9 was used for deceleration. This slower deceleration should reduce mixing in your gradient.
source_data.thread_text: With a SW-48 swinging-bucket rotor (Beckman), setting 9 was used for deceleration. This slower deceleration should reduce mixing in your gradient.
source_data.body: With a SW-48 swinging-bucket rotor (Beckman), setting 9 was used for deceleration. This slower deceleration should reduce mixing in your gradient.

components.data: Have sterile 0.5ml tubes (SW40) or 1.5ml tubes (SW28) labeled 1-24
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Have sterile 0.5ml tubes (SW40) or 1.5ml tubes (SW28) labeled 1-24
Open tubes in a rack.
Place tube on ring stand

components.data: Puncture about 2mm from the bottom side of the tube using a sterile 20 guage needle, bevel up.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Puncture about 2mm from the bottom side of the tube using a sterile 20 guage needle, bevel up.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 12 of Cesium Chloride Gradients
source_data.annotation: To make things easier, can pull off top sample layer with pipette as it will not contain any viruses after centrifugation; but drops will slow down as you reach the end of the collection.
source_data.thread_text: To make things easier, can pull off top sample layer with pipette as it will not contain any viruses after centrifugation; but drops will slow down as you reach the end of the collection.
source_data.body: To make things easier, can pull off top sample layer with pipette as it will not contain any viruses after centrifugation; but drops will slow down as you reach the end of the collection.

components.data: Collect droplets to fill each tube in order.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Collect droplets to fill each tube in order.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 13 of Cesium Chloride Gradients
source_data.annotation: Do not need to collect bottom layer as virus will not be in that layer.
source_data.thread_text: Do not need to collect bottom layer as virus will not be in that layer.
source_data.body: Do not need to collect bottom layer as virus will not be in that layer.

components.data: Place tube with sample on 4-place balance in holder.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place tube with sample on 4-place balance in holder.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 14 of Cesium Chloride Gradients
source_data.annotation: Make one by cutting off top 1" of 15cc tube with cap on.
source_data.thread_text: Make one by cutting off top 1" of 15cc tube with cap on.
source_data.body: Make one by cutting off top 1" of 15cc tube with cap on.

source_data.description: Tare to 0.
With sterile pipet tip, remove 100µl.
Take measurement.
Return sample to tube.

components.data: Remove another 100µl, take measurement, return sample to tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove another 100µl, take measurement, return sample to tube.

components.data: Remove yet another 100µl, take measurement, and return sample to tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove yet another 100µl, take measurement, and return sample to tube.

components.data: After all tubes have been measured, take average of the 3 values for each tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After all tubes have been measured, take average of the 3 values for each tube.
Multiply by 10.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 22 of Cesium Chloride Gradients
source_data.annotation: This will equal the density of the CsCl in that tube. For viruses, collect the p1.4-1.5 samples.
source_data.thread_text: This will equal the density of the CsCl in that tube. For viruses, collect the p1.4-1.5 samples.
source_data.body: This will equal the density of the CsCl in that tube. For viruses, collect the p1.4-1.5 samples.

components.data: Pool and extract DNA or can confirm presence of virus first by staining 10µl with SYBR gold
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pool and extract DNA or can confirm presence of virus first by staining 10µl with SYBR gold
Count under fluorescent scope.
Pool all samples with virus.
